title: Can't deserialize `Extension` and `ExtensionCatalog` as REST body payloads
body:
### Describe the bug

After the refactoring introduced in https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/commit/23601009bd22cb412d8c7f90cd7011aea62f4cc3 it is no longer possible to use `Extension` and `ExtensionCatalog` as Jackson body payloads (see https://github.com/quarkusio/registry.quarkus.io/blob/f8fe241ebf79c40e8ce1f9caf268e94245cbd3f4/src/main/java/io/quarkus/registry/app/admin/AdminApi.java#L90)

### Expected behavior

Allow using the `Extension` and `ExtensionCatalog` as body payloads in a REST request.

### Actual behavior

You can't.

### How to Reproduce?

See https://github.com/quarkusio/registry.quarkus.io/blob/f8fe241ebf79c40e8ce1f9caf268e94245cbd3f4/src/main/java/io/quarkus/registry/app/admin/AdminApi.java#L90

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

Fedora 35

### Output of `java -version`

JDK 17

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

2.6.0.Final

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Maven 3.8.4

### Additional information

_No response_
